wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[4 January|4]]''' - Author and linguist [[Arden R. Smith]] is born.
* '''[[6 January|6]]''' - [[A.R. Rahman]], composer of ''[[The Lord of the Rings (musical)]]'', is born.
* '''[[7 January|7]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 283]].
* '''[[7 January|7]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[letter to Roger Shaw]].
* '''[[10 January|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to Timothy J. Wheeler (10 January 1966)|letter to Timothy J. Wheeler]].
* '''[[11 January|11]]''' - [[Robert Farquharson]], who played [[Saruman]] and [[Denethor]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1955 radio series)]], dies.
* '''[[12 January|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to David Hicks|a letter to David Hicks]].
* '''[[12 January|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 283a]].
* '''[[29 January|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 283b]].
==February==
* '''[[10 February|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[letter to Donald A. Wollheim]].
* '''[[23 February|23]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 284]].
==March==
* '''?[[2 March|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is interviewed for the article "[[The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien]]".
* '''[[9 March|9]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Roger Verhulst (9 March 1966)|a letter to Roger Verhulst]].
* '''[[11 March|11]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 284a]].
* '''[[12 March|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to John Bush (12 March 1966)|letter to John Bush]].
* '''[[20 March|20]]''' - Director [[Kenji Kamiyama]] is born.
* '''[[21 March|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to George Sayer (21 March 1966)|a letter to George Sayer]].
==April==
* '''[[8 April|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 285]].
* '''[[8 April|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Roger Verhulst (8 April 1966)|a letter to Roger Verhulst]].
* '''[[12 April|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mother Mary Anthony|a letter to Mother Mary Anthony]].
* '''[[12 April|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to James Ridolfo|a letter to James Ridolfo]].
* '''[[14 April|14]]''' - Actor [[Lloyd Owen]] is born.
* '''[[19 April|19]]''' - [[Rayner Unwin]] writes [[Letter to Rayner Unwin (25 April 1966)|a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien]].
* '''[[25 April|25]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Rayner Unwin (25 April 1966)|a letter to Rayner Unwin]].
* '''[[27 April|27]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 286]].

==May==
* '''[[3 May|3]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Roger Verhulst (3 May 1966)|a letter to Roger Verhulst]].
* '''[[6 May|6]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to Martin M. Snapp|letter to Martin Snapp]].
* '''[[10 May|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes letters [[Letter 287|287]] and [[Letter 288|288]].
* '''[[30 May|30]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to Nancy Smith (30 May 1966)|letter to Nancy Smith]].
==June==
* '''[[1 June|1]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Royston F. Porthouse|a letter to Royston F. Porthouse]].
* '''[[9 June|9]]''' - [[John Garth]] is born.
* '''[[30 June|30]]''' - [[Marton Csokas]], who would play [[Celeborn]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.

==July==
* '''[[2 July|2]]''' - An issue of ''[[Saturday Evening Post (2 July 1966)|Saturday Evening Post]]'' is published, containing the [[The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien|an interview with Tolkien]].
* '''[[4 July|4]]''' – ''[[The Jerusalem Bible]]'' is published.
* '''[[23 July|23]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] has a formal dinner in [[Cambridge]].
* '''[[27 July|27]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives the unexpected visitors [[John Ryan|J.S. Ryan]] and [[Hans-Jörg Modlmayr]].
* '''[[29 July|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Michael George Tolkien (29 July 1966)|a letter to Michael Tolkien]], partly published as [[letter 289]].
* '''[[29 July|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Max Rouslin|a letter to Max Rouslin]].

==August==
* '''[[2 August|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is interviewed by [[William Cater]].
* '''[[6 August|6]]''' - [[Glasgow Herald (6 August 1966)|''Glasgow Herald'' (6 August 1966)]], including an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] by [[Daphne Castell]], is published.
* '''[[10 August|10]]''' - [[André Sogliuzzo]], who would provide many voices for Tolkien-themed [[:Category:Video games|video games]], is born.
* '''[[11 August|11]]''' - [[The Christian Science Monitor (11 August 1966)|''The Christian Science Monitor'' (11 August 1966)]], including an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] by [[Daphne Castell]], is published.
* '''[[August 19|19]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 289a]].
* '''[[24 August|24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] lends [[Rayner Unwin]] a reading-copy of ''[[The End of Bovadium]]''.
* '''[[25 August|25]]''' - [[Rayner Unwin]] writes a letter to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and suggests that ''[[The End of Bovadium]]'' be published in ''[[Wikipedia:The Oxford Magazine|The Oxford Magazine]]''.
* '''?''' - The magazine ''[[Rally - August, 1966]]'', with an essay on [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] by [[Jared Lobdell]], is published.
==September==
* '''[[12 September|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Rose MacNamara|a letter to Rose MacNamara]].
* '''?''' - ''[[The Tolkien Reader]]'' is published in the United States.
==October==
* '''[[11 October|11]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 289b]].
* '''[[12 October|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Kenneth I. Rasmussen, Jr.|a letter to Kenneth I. Rasmussen, Jr.]].
* '''[[14 October|14]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 289c]].
* '''[[16 October|16]]''' - Actress [[Mary Elizabeth McGlynn]] is born.
* '''[[17 October|17]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to a Primary School in Acocks Green|a letter to schoolchildren]].
* '''[[18 October|18]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 289d]].
* '''[[26 October|26]]''' - Finding himself short of a speech subject, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] reads ''[[Smith of Wootton Major]]'' to a room of about 800 people.
* '''[[27 October|27]] - The second edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is published.'''
* '''[[28 October|28]]''' - Tolkien writes [[letter 290]].
* '''?''' - The article "[[Tolkien on Tolkien]]" is published in ''Diplomat''.

==November==
* '''[[1 November|1]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] conducts an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]] with [[Dick Plotz|Richard Plotz]].
* '''[[7 November|7]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 290a]].
* '''[[22 November|22]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 291]].
* '''[[24 November|24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Harry C. Bauer|a letter to Harry C. Bauer]].
* '''[[30 November|30]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] conducts an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]], published as "[[The Man Who Understands Hobbits]]".
* '''[[30 November|30]]''' - ''[[Letters to an American Lady]]'' is released.
* '''?''' - [[New Worlds Vol. 50, No. 168|''New Worlds'' Vol. 50, No. 168]], including an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] by [[Daphne Castell]], is published.

==December==
* '''[[8 December|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to James S. Marsh (8 December 1966)|letter to James S. Marsh]].
* '''[[12 December|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 292]].
* '''[[14 December|14]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] inscribes a copy of the [[Hobitto no Bōken|Japanese ''Hobbit'']] to Father Hugh Maycock, and [[Letter to Father Hugh Maycock|includes a brief note]].
* '''[[15 December|15]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] signs three American editions of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' for Allen.
* '''[[29 December|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a second [[Letter to James S. Marsh (29 December 1966)|letter to James S. Marsh]].
* '''[[29 December|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 293]].

==?==
* '''Spring''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Rod Jellema|a letter to Rod Jellema]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] gifts the poem ''[[Bilbo's Last Song]]'' to his secretary, [[Joy Hill]]. 
* '''?''' - Second edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' by [[Allen & Unwin]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. lii</ref>
{{references}}
